text: The Dixon Creek (a.k.a. Limestone Creek) is a creek in Texas.H. Allen Anderson, "DIXON CREEK (CARSON COUNTY)," Handbook of Texas Online (http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/rbd56), accessed November 11, 2014. Uploaded on June 12, 2010. Published by the Texas State Historical Association.Dixon Creek watershed public meeting set for June 12, 2014 in Borger, Texas State Soil and Water Conservation Board It runs from north central Carson County through to Hutchinson County, all the way to the Canadian River. It flows through the 6666 Ranch near Panhandle, Texas and the Borger oilfield. It was named in honor of Billy Dixon. ==See also== *List of rivers of Texas ==References== Category:Carson County, Texas Category:Hutchinson County, Texas Category:Rivers of Texas
title: Dixon Creek (creek)
